Playa Cabana	4	2020-02-26	"I was tasked with finding a spot for a group dinner of eight and landed on Playa Cabana. It was pretty easy to make a reservation via their email system and our table was ready upon arrival. I don't know why I was expecting more of a kitschy Mexican restaurant
column2: but that's not what we got. Instead
column3: it was very intimate and cozy and the service was stellar... We had a great night!

column1: To start
column2: we opted for some guac which was tasty and had a nice little kick to it. To eat
column3: I split the elotes a la parrilla and an order of tacos al pastor with my husband. The soft tacos come in an order of three but you can add on a fourth
column4: so we did that to share evenly. It was the perfect amount of food for us
column5: especially since the tortilla chips kept flowing! The pork in the tacos was seasoned very well. I'm used to the meat being cubed rather than in strips
column6: so this was different but still tasty. They really packed in the filling
column7: so I left super full.

column1: To sip
column2: we shared pitches of mojitos which were nice and strong... The drink menu was quite lengthy and again
column3: perfect for our group of revelers.

column1: Mexican in Canada seemed like a risky choice
column2: but this was an ideal meal for us! Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for tacos OR a nice group dinner joint."

column1: Playa Cabana	3	2019-08-04	"Went here with my friends and family. I liked the spice side fillings and their lobster tacos was good I heard. I had the veggie enchiladas and was alright. Even the veggie tostadas was good. However
column2: I feel the food was expensive for the food quality.

column1: We got the
Nachos  - small but good
Guacamole and chips - good needed some spice
Chicken wings - so so
Veggie enchiladas - was so so
Veggie burrito - good
Veggie tostados - good
Shrimp enchiladas - was so so
Lobster tacos - very good
Fish tacos - very good
Pork tacos - was so so"

Playa Cabana	3	2019-08-24	"Surprisingly good Flautas! They came as 3 rolls made of a crunchy tortilla containing lots of shredded juicy beef (although I thought it tasted more like pork haha). It all sat in a pool of thick savoury sauce that wasn't overly salty. I also tried their White Wine Sangria
column2: $60 for a pitcher was OK for this citrusy drink with a decent amount of alcohol!

column1: TIP: if you're celebrating a birthday
column2: let the staff know and they'll surprise the bday person with a hat
column3: song & free slice of a DELICIOUS dulce Leche soaked cake !

column1: Otherwise
column2: the indoor seating space is really tight and the service was subpar."

column1: Playa Cabana	4	2019-06-06	"As a Mexican I always crave authentic Mexican food in Toronto but have difficulties finding it. Playa Cabana is very good and does a an amazing job at keeping things as authentic as possible.
Today at lunch I had the chips and salsa which were yummy. The Playa Burrito with Pork Carnitas was also very good. The green salsa was a bit citrusy but overall very good. I would order it again.
This is definitely a place to come back for some great Mexican food. Staff were also friendly and fast."
Playa Cabana	5	2020-05-25	Best tacos I've ever had. Both locations are great and offer a great selection of Mexican fare.
Playa Cabana	4	2019-08-31	"Food was exceptional and service was pretty fast. It's in a weird location tho only visited because it was about 10 minute walk from the ROM.

Only issues was the seating area was a bit small inside so you feel squished. But they have some more spots outside for when it's a nice day. I recommend to anyone who wants to try real authentic Mexican food. Everything tastes fresh and makes you want to order more."
Playa Cabana	4	2019-04-07	"Their space is a bit cramped
column2: but Playa Cabana makes it work.

column1: I'm a big fan of Mexican and am of the opinion that Toronto is starving of good Mexican food. Playa Cabana

column1: Next time

column1: Playa Cabana	4	2019-01-16	"Okay
column2: so I found my new favourite Latin spot. I was frequenting the other Playa Cabana on Dundas W - however they changed their menu and all went to hell in my opinion. I recently dined at Playa Cabana and was wow'd. This place really needs 5 stars because the food was AMAZING

column1: It wasn't busy at all when I walked in

column1: Ordered the short rib tacos because holy hell it sounded amazing

column3: I love short rib) grilled Mexican corn
column4: the tres leche cake & Churros. Relax
column5: relax
column6: I wasn't alone. The tacos were delicious
column7: please please don't change the menu! I have to say the Enchiladas were my favourite. The beans had so much flavour
column8: the sauces were perfect & the combination of all the flavours with the extra sauces on the table made my life complete! The grilled corn was okay
column9: but nothing special.

column1: Moving on to the highlight - Dessert! Wow! The Churros were actually fucking amazing. So crunchy
column2: so much sugar. The cake was nothing like I've tasted
column3: so moist and light. I could have eaten 3 slices!

column1: PLEASE DO NOT CHANGE THE MENU! I will be back!
Keep Eating
Angela"

Playa Cabana	4	2019-12-12	Went last week. Food is very good! Churros were amazing  and drinks are made with fair amount of alcohol compared to other places. Friendly staff! Would recommended! Make sure to make reservations as it is a very very cozy place. Unless you don't mind sitting at the bar
column2: as I did.

column1: Playa Cabana	4	2019-01-12	"Yes all day er'rday to their chips -- they make a fresh batch each day! No pic of that here since we ate them so fast along with the fresh red salsa.

I'm looking forward to trying the other locations as I think the menus differ slightly. Nice place!"
Playa Cabana	4	2018-05-13	"I was skeptical of this place at first as it look like I'm walking into a duplex

column1: Playa Cabana	4	2018-04-21	"Playa Cabana is a pretty small restaurant

column1: Playa Cabana	3	2018-09-07	"My friend and I decided on Mexican food for dinner and this popped up as nearby where we were at the time

column1: Playa Cabana	5	2018-10-04	I'm a long-term fan of Playa Cabana restaurants

column1: Playa Cabana	4	2018-01-25	"Playa Cabana is about a 15 minute walk from my office and I hadn't planned on going there but the person I had an appointment with nearby wasn't available so I decided to have lunch first.
Walking in

Playa Cabana	5	2019-04-03	Best salsa ever! Honestly everything was really good and so was the service and the atmosphere. We had guacamole

column1: Playa Cabana	3	2018-08-13	"I've been duped by yelp reviews!! We were given recommendations for this place as a great lunch spot which was super cute inside and patio area was so inviting. The stars were for the decor and the one dish!

Playa Cabana	5	2019-04-05	"My bf and I decided to come to this Mexican restaurant to celebrate his birthday after reading such good reviews about the tacos - and we can now confirm they taste just as good as they look!
We started with the chips and guacamole (which was more than plentiful for 2 people and was super fresh!) and Dave's Margaritas to wash it all down. For tacos
column2: they come in a set of 3
column3: and we opted for the Short Rib Brisket Crispy Tacos
column4: Baja Style Fish Tacos
column5: and the Al Pastor Tacos. The Short Rib and Baja Fish Tacos were by far our favourites of the 3. The Short Rib was tender
column6: juicy
column7: flavourful and served with guac
column8: pico de gallo and cotija cheese on a crispy corn tortilla that had a layer of melted cheese at the base. YUM! The Baja Fish tacos (served with fresh lime and cabbage slaw) were also equally delicious and we fell in love with the batter. If you love a good fish taco
column9: these are the ones to get!

column1: Since we both love pineapple we knew we had to get the Al Pastor tacos
column2: however
column3: we were disappointed when our tacos did not arrive with the roasted pineapple as listed on the menu (but instead a slice of mandarin?). While the pork was flavourful
column4: it was our least favourite of the three... and we were really looking forward to the pineapple!

column1: For dessert

column3: which for $10 was a bit pricey for 3 small churros. Served in a cup with caramel sauce and marshmellow curds (we opted out of the marshmellow)
column4: they were perfectly fried and warm with a soft center and crisp cinnamon-sugar outside. Definitely satisfied our sweet tooth!

column1: It's a small restaurant so plan ahead and make a reservation! Our server was super friendly and service was quick. Plus
column2: the tacos were seriously some of our favourites we've had - you can't go wrong."

column1: Playa Cabana	5	2019-02-01	"Let me just say right off the bat: THEY HAVE ALL YOU CAN EAT CHIPS AND GUACAMOLE!!!!!!!!!

Playa Cabana	5	2017-09-18	"Love this place! I had a mad craving for tacos one day

column1: Obviously

column4: but I most certainly can comment on the flavours and presentation of the food. My opinion is WOW... just Wow. Seriously delicious food. I had the octopus tacos
column5: guacamole with chips and finished off with crab cakes. I also had a beer

column1: I tried a few different hot sauces
column2: and boy

Wilbur Mexicana	5	2020-03-31	"Wilbur is a great place for fast casual mexican food if you are spending some time downtown. They are in the heart of the King Street West Entertainment District so getting there is easy if you are using public transportation.

I love their taco selection. I generally get the fish and beef options anywhere I go but I really love the mushroom taco at Wilburs. The best part of going to the restaurant itself is their selection of delicious hot sauces and salsa options!

I like that they are a hybrid self serve restaurant. You order at the bar and they bring the food to you but you have to get up and help yourself to the (unlimited) water from the cooler and also the sauces.
I can't wait for the warm weather to go sit on the patio at Wilburs and watch the crowds walk by on King West."
Wilbur Mexicana	4	2020-03-30	"This busy place has some damn tasty tacos. While I normally really chase the 'authenticity' dragon when it comes to tacos
column2: I do really enjoy this place as well.

column1: Pros:
1. The menu is simple and straightforward. You can get tacos and bowls

column1: Wilbur Mexicana	4	2020-03-27	"WHAT TO TRY?!

The Mexican corn!! I love their corn with that wonderful seasoning! The quesadillas are are also delicious too especially when it comes piping hot and the tortilla is lightly pan fried. The sauce is a great mix which makes it more flavourful.

I liked the baja fried fish tacos the most out of all the tacos because it had the right combination of garnishes and the tortilla is corn over flour. The bulgogi taco was a bit too sweet for my liking tho. It is flavorful and full of sauce but the marinade they used for that taco may be too much.
I also tried the avocado taco. It's a grilled quarter piece of avocado in the tortilla. I would have liked it if it wasn't that big of a chunk tho because although outside is grilled
column2: inside is just plain old avocado. Having sliced a bit more thinner would have been nicer.

column1: The mushroom taco is a good vegetarian alternative for tacos and comes with great flavour. Lots of mushrooms but it's not some fancy mushrooms. Just regular mushrooms though.
The asada
column2: pork and chicken tacos are always a good staple to have for tacos. They are cooked with a lot of flavours which are great!

column1: LAST TIP?!
They have water for free so if you are fine with water as a refreshment
column2: then don't have to worry about ordering any other drinks. Quesadillas come with guacamole and chips on the side so no need to order more guacamole and chips as a snack! However tacos only come with chips
column3: no complimentary guacamole - just something to keep in mind!"

column1: Wilbur Mexicana	4	2020-03-07	"I visited this place on a weekday evening. They don't have any table reservations and it's the first come basis. You place your order on the counter and then go and find yourself a table. The food is delivered at the table. There is a common area where water & cutlery is available for self service.

The place stands out from the other Mexican places because of their Salsa counter. They have 7 different kinds of Salsas which are free with your meal. Try some of the spicy salsas at your own risk. Their Ghost Salsa is extremely spicy. Now
column2: let's talk about food. I tried their Veggie Burrito
column3: Mushroom Tacos & Grilled Avocado Taco. The portion sizes were good and value for money. They serve complimentary tortilla chips with every entree. Burritos had a quinoa filling but you can upgrade to rice for 1 dollar. Tacos were really good with a nice blend of sauces. For my taste buds
column4: burrito felt a little dry though. Overall
column5: a nice place to try some Mexican options."

column1: Wilbur Mexicana	5	2020-02-03	"I would give this resto ten stars if I could.

column1: Wilbur Mexicana	5	2019-10-10	"One of our favourite taco spots in the city. Just go there for true hot sauce bar. Truly fantastic.

column1: Wilbur Mexicana	5	2020-01-09	"My favourite Mexican fast food restaurant! By fast food

column1: Wilbur Mexicana	5	2019-09-03	"Since my first Wilbur visit I have ventured back my times and each better then the last!

Wilbur Mexicana	3	2019-07-23	"For what this spot is

column1: Wilbur Mexicana	5	2019-08-03	"I found this place after simply yelping tacos in the area. Wilbur had amazing reviews so we decided to walk to this place from the CN Tower. When we got there the line was out the door and around the corner so we knew it was a popping place.

Wilbur Mexicana	5	2019-12-06	"Absolutely the most delicious and fresh Mexican food that is affordable and in a sit down place with great service. column1: Como En Casa	3	2019-07-07	"Rating: 3/5
Summary:

We believe this restaurant is worth a visit if in the area. We have frequented this place multiple times and there is a reason we keep coming back. The service is extremely friendly and the atmosphere
column2: though tight
column3: is rather warm and welcoming. However
column4: one must be careful when picking their dish because while some taste wonderfully flavorful
column5: others are somewhat disappointing.

column1: The dishes we tried:
- burrito w/ verde sauce
- fish tacos
- chicken enchiladas
- chicken mole
- guac/salsa w/ chips
- mains circa $12-15
- appetizers circa $6-8
Food:
One of our favorite dishes is the Burrito with Verde Sauce. It's a big hot burrito packed with many flavors. What makes it special
column2: however
column3: is the verde sauce that complements the burrito very well. The verde sauce is a tangy and spicy sauce that consists of tomatillos
column4: jalapenos
column5: and lime. You probably won't get burritos smothered with a delicious sauce at other places where you'd think of getting a burrito (Chipotle
column6: etc.). We'd also point out that the Guacamole tastes extremely fresh with a great rich and creamy feel. The chunky and spicy salsa is also great. The two dipping sauces pair well with the tortilla chips and is worth considering if looking for an appetizer.

column1: However
column2: we were disappointed with some of the dishes we ordered. For example
column3: the enchiladas and chicken mole did not satisfy at all. As for the enchiladas
column4: the ones we had were filled with extremely dry chicken and the wrap itself was also unappetizing.

column1: On a positive note
column2: the service is remarkable. The owner once even gave us a free refill for our horchata (a most delightful sweet drink consisting of rice
column3: vanilla
column4: and cinnamon). The servers are very kind and patient
column5: thus contributing to a better dining experience.

column1: Conclusion:
Google reviews rates this as a 4.5/5. We give it a 3/5. It's worth a visit if in the area
column2: but there are only certain dishes worth eating. We recommend the chicken or burrito with verde sauce and the horchata.

column1: For more quality pictures and honest reviews
column2: follow us on Instagram @pchan_and_sam_reviews. We hope you like our content!"

Seven Lives Tacos y Mariscos	4	2020-01-30	"Knowing where to get the best tacos in town is serious business. As it stands
column2: the best tacos that I have ever eaten have been at Tacofino in Tofino and Tres Carnales Taquera in Edmonton. After reading that Seven Lives was voted #1 Best Taco 2018 by NOW Toronto
column3: named in National Geographic magazine's Places of a Lifetime article
column4: and called #1 Best Fish Taco and #1 Best Tacos by blogTO... They seemed like a sure bet.

column1: You'll find Seven Lives located in Kensington Market
column2: one of the most eclectic corners of the city which suits them well. I visited the tiny shop on a Friday evening
column3: prior to their early closing time of 7pm. They're definitely more of a lunch or early dinner type of place. It should also be noted that they accept cash only
column4: so come prepared!

column1: The tiny shop is bustling and exciting
column2: buzzing with taco energy. The bright walls and giant sign that reads ""TACOS"" sets the vibe perfectly. I also appreciate their logo of a cat with a fish in its mouth - and the insinuation that this cat is down to seven lives
column3: having already lost two. There is one table that can seat about four people and then there's a little bit of standing-room-only counter space. This makes things a little bit awkward if you plan to eat-in
column4: as I did. The table wasn't available and so I stood at the counter in front of the window to eat instead. Which was fine. But certainly not ideal.

column1: The menu is fairly straight forward
column2: including nine types of tacos
column3: some sides
column4: and some beverages. Your order is placed at the counter with a friendly staff member and they call out your name once the food is ready.

column1: Starting with something to drink
column2: I was happy to see Agua de Jamaica on the menu. I always prefer an agua fresca when visiting a Mexican establishment
column3: although I was also happy to see that Jarritos Mexican sodas are also on offer. (Their cola is my personal favourite of all of the colas.) Agua de Jamaica
column4: otherwise known as ""hibiscus water"" is a beverage that exists in several cultures. In Southeast Asia it is known as Rosella tea and it's basically the same thing. Tart and sweet
column5: this refreshing drink was a perfect accompaniment to the food.

column1: We decided to get a Side as a bit of an appetizer. Tortilla Chips (Made fresh! - $3.00) and Guacamole ($3.00 for small) seemed like the way to go. I was a bit surprised that the guacamole didn't just come with tortilla chips and that both items had to be purchased separately. However
column2: I did enjoy the homemade nature of the chips and that a heaping amount of them are tossed into a brown paper bag and given to you. I'll take a bag of chips any day. Golden and ultra crispy
column3: these tortilla chips are exactly what I wanted them to be. They were seasoned really nicely as well. The guacamole was fresh and bright
column4: with a great acidic kick to it. Obviously chips and guac are a match made in heaven.

column1: Next it was time for the big show: the TACOS. Of the nine tacos available
column2: two of them (the Adobada and the Carnitas) were already sold out. On the plus side
column3: I probably wouldn't have ordered either of these anyway. Although
column4: I must say that this did not leave much for meat options. There were four fish/seafood tacos
column5: one beef and one chicken option
column6: and a vegetarian. Nothing for pork at all. But again
column7: I did not mind at all because I was going full ocean food - it's what they specialize in
column8: after all.

column1: Baja Fish ($6.00) and Gobernador ($6.00) were the ones for me. I loved the little condiments bar to the left of the counter that featured three different salsas (hot habanero
column2: medium tomatillo
column3: mild guajillo) as well as chili oil with sesame
column4: and a bowl of sliced limes. This makes it very easy to customize your tacos to your preferred specifications and to control the amount of heat that you desire.

column1: The tacos did not take very long and before I knew it
column2: a green plastic basket was placed in my hands. The tacos were certainly vibrant and demanding to be eaten.

column1: I began with the Gobernador (smoked marlin
column2: shrimp & cheese). If Seven Lives has a signature taco
column3: this is the one. Their front window even says ""home of the Gobernador"" right on it. I definitely loved the smokiness from the marlin the most
column4: while the shrimp filled out the taco and added more texture. Everything had been grilled up deliciously. The pickled onion brought a great hit of balancing flavour and I liked the fresh tortillas a lot.

column1: Next I had the Baja Fish (fried haddock). The first thing that I noticed is how generous the portion of fish is! The haddock was big
column2: juicy and fried to perfection. The rest of the taco was kept very fresh with cabbage and fresh homemade salsa on top.

column1: Both tacos were packed full and were pretty messy to eat
column2: but in the best possible way. I liked both tacos but found them to be missing something that I can't quite put my finger on. I guess that I was hoping for something even bigger and more unexpected in terms of flavour. They were good... Just not the best that I've ever had.

column1: I was also very impressed to see a C"

column1: We had the tacos with haddock
column2: beef short ribs
column3: chicken tinga and tongue
column4: and they were all flavourful bursts of juicy deliciousness; light and carefully crafted that looked so much fun to eat. It tastes like lots of time
column5: effort
column6: and love were folded in as the main ingredients in this timeless
column7: traditional Mexican dish. We wanted to try them all-and we most definitely will next time (and as much as our waistline allows!).

column1: On the menu
column2: there's also:

column1: - Quesadillas: $6
- Drinks: $2-3
- Masa (dough made from corn flour; used to make tortillas): $10/kg
- Tortillas: $14/kg
As a downtown Toronto Yelper
column2: Good Hombres is midway between Dundas and Ossington (hipster mecca) and Chinatown (dim-sum heaven) and across the street from Toronto Western Hospital. But more importantly
column3: it's a new taqueria that is worth coming back time after time for authentic
column4: juicy
column5: flavourful tacos that are a joy to eat. -Tell them Will and Justin from Yelp sent you here and wear your stretchiest pants
column6: your belly will thank you.

Good Hombres	4	2019-11-10	This place serves some really great tacos! Service is very quick as we got our food in a couple of minutes. We were seated at the bar and were able to see everything being made fresh. Everything was delicious and my favourite is the Pescado!

Good Hombres	5	2019-04-28	Hands down the most authentic tacos that you can possibly get in Toronto! The shells are made in house out of corn and are really soft and supple. Everything is made with love. Even the way the tacos were served was how they serve it in Mexico - on these colourful frisbees meant to be used as dishes. This place can get super crowded but that is only a testament as to how good their food is.
Good Hombres	5	2019-06-16	"Delicious
column2: unpretentious tacos in a hidden gem of a restaurant.

column1: El Trompo Taco Bar	4	2019-09-18	"If there are three words that will get me into almost any dining establishment it is this ""Al Pastor Tacos"".

El Trompo Taco Bar	4	2019-09-02	The long line ups here are worth the wait! We got some tacos today and really enjoyed how soft and slightly chewy the taco shells were with delicious chicken and tofu filling. I was pleasantly surprised with how filling and tasty the vegetarian option was

column1: El Trompo Taco Bar	4	2018-10-23	"I've never eaten street tacos in Mexico
column2: but El Trompo markets itself as offering exactly those and I imagine that they're not wrong in doing so. These are ""street"" in the way ""street"" should connote - quick and simple. They won't blow you away. In fact
column3: the might not even impress you much. But if you're looking for tacos at a reasonable price

column5: but that's what the menu recommends so I thought I'd give 'em a try. Not bad! None of the porky taste I generally shy away from
column6: and the pineapple is a nice touch. I was worried they'd be dry based on looking at them
column7: but the pineapple substituted nicely for what could've (should've?) been fat. I asked for a shot of their cheapest tequila

column1: The truth is this place is underwhelming. There used to be a terrific place for tacos just down the street in a sort of makeshift food court
column2: but it's since shut down. I give El Trompo 4 stars mostly because it's been there a while and I worry what might come after it. Kensington Market is a gem

column1: Campechano Taquera	4	2020-03-02	"Campechano Taqueria is tucked away inconspicuously at the corner of Adelaide/Portland. Inside you'll find a quiet
column2: mellow and hip taqueria that makes for a great date spot or catch-up dinner with friends. I'd say that Campechano is distinct from other popular taquerias nearby such as Wilbur and Mi Taco in that it is a lot more of a sit-down place and not so much a take-out or eat-and-go type of place
column3: so if you're looking for more of that vibe

column1: Campechano's tacos are noticeably pricier than other taquieras nearby
column2: and although tasty
column3: I honestly found it hard to justify the extra cost. My buddy and I went for a taco crawl and we went to the two aforementioned taquerias and we both agreed that Campechano's tacos left quite a bit to be desired as the last taqueria in our crawl. Although most of the tacos come with avocado
column4: which is often a premium ingredient

column6: made with braised lamb
column7: was a little bit too chewey for my liking. Nonetheless
column8: Campechano serves delicious tacos and provides a unique atmosphere and dining experience so it is definitely worth going to."

column1: Campechano Taquera	4	2020-02-08	"Campechano is a great place for vegetarians and meat eaters alike. Their menu contains options for both and items are sold by piece
column2: so everyone can order whatever they want.

column1: Most tables start with the guacamole ($8) where it arrives with two cups brimming with thin crispy chips
column2: which they refill if you finish the tortilla before the dips. The salsa roja is great
column3: with just a bit of spice and plenty of zest. It leaves the guacamole feeling fairly neutral
column4: jazzed up with pomegranate - an interesting twist
column5: though personally I do enjoy my dip without fruit.

column1: If you're feeling hungry than order a sencillo sopes ($6) for yourself; otherwise
column2: it's hearty enough to share. The tortilla is thicker and soft
column3: almost like naan but not oily. A layer of refried beans is spread on top with lettuce
column4: cheese
column5: and two types of sauce covering the pillowy tortilla. A different alternative to Campechano's tacos
column6: but not nearly as exciting.

column1: If you can handle spice
column2: the hongo ahumado ($6) has a healthy kick of fiery sauce drizzled on top. This heat was unexpected as the taco's description made it sound earthy tasting
column3: from the smoked mushroom base
column4: with a hearty finish
column5: thanks to the white bean puree. In reality
column6: aside from the spice
column7: it's rather fresh with plenty of herbs sprinkled over top and very tasty
column8: despite all the water you'll have afterwards.

column1: On the other hand
column2: the healthy sprinkling of cotija cheese on the rajas ($5) makes the roasted poblano peppers taco richer than you'd expect. Additionally
column3: the peppers aren't spicy at all
column4: instead having a deep earthiness. With little bits of corn added for bite
column5: this was another tasty taco.

column1: Campechano's dining room is small and cozy
column2: so try to make a reservation. Regardless
column3: there seems to be plenty of walk-ins and on our weekday dinner visit
column4: the wait wasn't long... their service is friendly and efficient so most tables turn over quickly."

column1: Campechano Taquera	4	2019-08-09	"After hearing so much buzz about Campechano both online and among my colleagues

column1: I had a reservation for 6:30PM

column4: my friend and I quickly ordered some tacos each. We shared the guac & chips
column5: and both got the barbacoa (lamb leg with spicy guajillo and jalapeno) and carnitas (pulled pork shoulder with salsa verde)

column1: Guac - It was super interesting to see the guac topped with pomegranate seeds
column2: which added a beautiful pop of vibrant colour and burst of sweet flavour! The guac was good
column3: the chips were delicious

column1: Barbacoa - Came with huge and meaty chunks of tender lamb leg. I loved the gamey taste
column2: though the creamy
column3: spicy dressing was a little too heavy for me. That said
column4: this was one of my favourites just because it was so comforting and filling!

column1: Carnitas - Similar to the barbacoa
column2: there were generous and copious amounts of confit pulled pork. Although this was dressed with only salsa verde
column3: I found it to feel a little heavier - mostly because with every bite came a healthy gush of oil drizzling down my chin. It was definitely less spicy
column4: and you could taste the different flavours more!

column1: Rajas - I sampled one bite of my friend's

column1: After finishing

column3: and our thoughts were:

column1: - The masa tortillas were FANTASTIC. It was both soft and yielding
column2: sturdy enough to hold all the fillings and sauces without being soggy.

column1: - We really appreciated that the toppings/fillings were simple - my friend pointed out that the tacos didn't have any of the heavy

column1: - We would most definitely come again!!! Or try out the sister restaurant

Campechano Taquera	4	2019-06-26	"A great spot for some tacos!

column1: Campechano Taquera	5	2019-11-06	"Campechano has slowly become my favourite taco place in the city. The more I dine here the more I fall in love with the food
column2: the decor
column3: and the restaurant overall.

column1: Fair warning though
column2: I'm not the only one who loves Campechano! Make reservations in advance because the wait can be up to an hour sometimes without one. If you're looking to make reservations for a Friday or Saturday night
column3: I recommend booking at least a week before.

column1: The decor is simple and bright. Unlike other taco places
column2: they don't dim their lights too much at night so you don't have to worry about squinting to see in front of you. The restaurant is quite small so it can feel a bit cramped when it gets busy
column3: especially when you have to get up from the table. It's not too big of an issue when you're seated though! The servers are friendly and decently attentive
column4: especially for a busy restaurant. Prices are fair when comparing to other sit-down taco places like La Carnita and El Catrin.

column1: For starters
column2: the chips and guacamole is a must-have. The guacamole is topped with a seasonal garnish. Last time I went it was pomegranate seeds
column3: which gives it a nice sweet crunch. Their homemade chips are unlike your regular tortilla chips. They are so crispy and yummy
column4: I would happily just come for the chips alone. They also offer refills of the chips
column5: which makes them even more amazing!

column1: The tacos are just as good as the guacamole. The tortilla (also homemade) for the tacos is so good and really ties every taco together nicely. I love the Carnitas (confit pork shoulder) and the Barbacoa (braised lamb leg). If you like spicy
column2: the Pollo Al Pastor (chicken thigh) will set your mouth on fire! The fish taco is also quite good. It tastes fresh and is fried to perfection. It's a definite must for someone who doesn't like spice.

column1: All in all
column2: if you're a fan of tacos
column3: Campechano is a must-try! You won't be disappointed!"

column1: Campechano Taquera	4	2018-03-17	"Rating: This is a solid 3 1/2* with the bump of 1/2* for the circumstance of my visit.

So what was I to do?
I decided to get a smaller dish at the lunch place in order to stop at Campechano for a few tacos. Luckily
column2: I have a wife and daughter that humours me in my food pursuit.

column1: We arrived just after 2pm and the waitress informed us that the last call will be in 15 minutes as they close at 2:30pm. That was no problem since I was the only one interested in ordering something. This is a small place and I could see seating being an issue at busier times. Love their wall mural.

The wait staff quickly provided us with a menu. I was disappointed that there was no shrimp tacos for lunch. So I decided to order the Bistec (Top Sirloin) and the Tinga de pollo (Chicken Breast). There's no way you could just order one taco even though you kind of full.

The tacos came out fairly quick as you can see it being cooked in front of you as they have an open kitchen. I liked the Tinga the best. Both of the tacos had the Morita sauce which provided a nice little kick but the Bistec was overtly salty. Also the prices are a little steep but based on location
column2: I can understand why.

column1: My dining experience at Campechano probably took no more than 10 minutes plus it was right before closing. That's why I want to give them the benefit of the doubt and bump up the rating to 4*. I'm hoping to come back for dinner and ask if they offer shrimp tacos.
Solid tacos but not the best in the GTA.

column2: cilantro & lime did to it. And I can't forget about that creamy avocado spread!

column3: but more ""hearty"". The flour tortilla was thinner than what I have eaten at Mexican restaurants in Kensington Market.

column1: All 3 types of taco fillings were good! But if I have to rank them
column2: my favourite would be the chicken
column3: beef and pork. I couldn't identify any individual flavours from any of the tacos
column4: but the chicken one stood out in terms of well balanced flavour and the meat was not dry at all. I found the pork to be a bit dry.

column1: My friend ordered the same taco combo as me
column2: plus a pork burrito on flour tortilla. (Haha
column3: don't judge
column4: he didn't have a proper meal for the whole day.) The pork burrito was quite big

column2: it was okay. It was kind of bland and the portion was small for the price (~40g?) - don't think I will be getting it again. However

column1: I will be back to try the burrito!!!"

La Carnita	4	2018-12-24	"La Carnita is one hip taco joint in the heart of the downtown core. We were a party of five on a Friday night so we had reserved our seats in advance. Our server was super knowledgeable about the menu and really gave us useful insights and advice of what to order.

La Carnita	3	2018-12-16	"There's lots of mixed reviews for this restaurant. Glowing reviews versus one that speak of terrible service. My review errs on the side of the not so good. I'd say 2.5 stars for me.

Are all Mexican restaurants so dim? It seems that the ones I've been to are always so dark and hard to see. In terms of price it's on the pricey side. My friend took me to a food truck in LA and it was either $1 or $1.50 per taco. I suppose you're paying for the atmosphere and sit down service but ~$6/taco is quite the surcharge. I'll give them that the carne asada taco was tasty but in my opinion that still doesn't justify paying so much per taco. They're small so it's not like you're going to have just 1.
I saw horchata on the menu and decided to try it here. It was very watered down. I didn't taste any cinnamon at all either. definitely not worth $4.

The server told us that they want to be the best fried chicken place in Toronto. I'd say that they have quite a ways to go until they can claim that title. Perhaps it was just the pieces I got but the skin was soft and not crispy. It was also kinda bland without slathering it in sauce. Turns out the dip that we had with the chips was a better accompaniment for the fried chicken instead of the sauce it came with. Go figure.

column1: Their drink menu is quite expansive and we decided to start our night off with a margarita. She really loved the bubbly champagne surprise in her margarita and I found the blend of tequila and whiskey was appropriate which did not lead to any bad decisions later in the night haha.

I was only feeling peckish so I ordered the Mexican street corn and the smoked Mexican wings. column2: wing

I think that Chula is a welcome addition to this Gerrard St. neighbourhood."

column1: MEXITACO	2	2019-09-25	"This has been a regular lunch spot for me this past year though I won't be returning .

MEXITACO	4	2017-08-18	"It's hard to find good quality Mexican food in Toronto.  It's even harder to find a place that isn't downtown.  Well thankfully a good friend mentioned this place had moved and was now in the east end.  Blink and you might miss it but it's on the corner of Victoria Park and St Clair (right across the No Frills).

It's small inside but they pack in a lot of tables.  Went on a Friday night and the place was jumping jumping.  As the night wore on it just got busier (apparently around 8-9pm there is a show Friday nights).  We were finished eating by that time and stayed a bit to see if started but we ended up leaving as we didn't want to hog the table when others needed it.
I wasn't super hungry so I ordered the beer battered shrimp tacos and the baha fish tacos (you get 2 of each).  They were delicious.  No greasy
column2: not bland
column3: just delicious.  The owners/staff are from what I have heard are Mexican.  So they know what they are cooking.

column1: The atmosphere is lively
column2: the service is friendly and the food is GREAT.  I will definitely add this as one of my regular rotations of deliciousness"

column1: MEXITACO	4	2018-06-06	"A somewhat limited review since I came in during a work lunch break (no drinks) and I went for the fajita platter (Texmex) rather than possibly more authentic Mexican items on the menu.

Not much else to report on

column1: La Chingada	5	2019-02-25	"La Chingada is located on the north side of Dundas just east of Dovercourt.

It's not often I have the opportunity of going to soft openings of places that aren't officially open yet.  I was searching for a place to grab a quick small bite and have a drink before going to the Stephen Bulger Gallery just down the street.  I didn't find much interesting between Gladstone and Dovercourt so I decided to walk a bit further east and I see ""Mexican street food"".  Hello
column2: harbor in the storm.

column1: So I discovered that La Chingada has only opened 5 days ago and not even officially yet.  Their official opening is this Friday (March 1st).  I really had only about half an hour to order
column2: eat and get to our event so I thought this was a perfect spot.

column1: I'll admit that I too am spoiled by Mexican food from southern California.  It's a snob thing kind of how my wife scoffs at things like the Olive Garden or Pizza Hut Italian Bistro trying to pass off their cuisine as Italian.  I get it.  People are used to places that serve the best of the best and once they are spoiled it's hard to dial things back to whatever may be available to us.  In this case
column2: La Chingada is not only north of Bloor
column3: north of the US border but also north of the Mexican border as well.  Let me just say that regardless of geography this place serves some of the best tacos I've ever had the opportunity of tasting.

column1: So while I had ordered 6 different tacos this was within 2 visits within 3 hours of each other.  Honestly I wasn't planning on going back so soon but one of my friends that wasn't with my other friend and I the first time wanted to give it a try after I had spoken just going there.
The first visit I had ordered the barbacoa
column2: tinga de pollo
column3: carnitas and chorizo.  The barbacoa and chicken were my friend's order but I had a taste of the barbacoa and the beef was rich and full of flavor.  I loved the compliment of the tangy queso fresca that topped it as well.

column1: My plate consisted of the carnitas and the chorizo.  Chorizo is normally my favorite filling and while it was a solid savory choice I had to give it up to what I thought was the true champion of the evening which was the carnitas.  I loved the bit of crisp to the pulled pork and the meat was very juicy but not wet.  Does that even make sense?  I normally really enjoy  carnitas but these were beyond that. These were without a doubt the best carnitas I've had.  My wife makes carnitas and thankfully
column2: she won't read this review.  It's ok because we'll end up coming here sometime soon and she'll get to try them and I won't need to say anything.  It's sort of the equivalent of watching a movie and my wife saying wow
column3: that actress is so pretty.  Ya
column4: I just won't answer because it's a trap.

column1: The second visit my friend that didn't come the first time ordered the chicharrone.  These weren't the kind of pork rinds you find in a plastic bag at the grocery store chip aisle.  Dang these were huge pieces of rind.  I had to break pieces apart because they were so big.  The rinds came with tomatoes
column2: a green salsa and some guacamole.

column1: For my second round I had ended up ordering the blackened fish and carne asada.  The fish was very good
column2: grilled with a flaky texture.  I forgot to ask what fish they used but it wasn't a strong flavor and a lighter fish.  The carne asada was also very good and very filling.

column1: The portions here seem quite generous but the quality and mix of flavors are all pretty well balanced.  I liked the variety
column2: presentation
column3: flavors and overall quality of the food here.  The tortillas are real deal corn tortillas with a dense integrity.  There's no need to ""double up"" since they aren't thin and won't disintegrate because of the filling.  These tacos although they are quite filled (some filling may fall out) I found kept their shape and they didn't fall apart and weren't awkward.  Being able to pick them up and eat them to me is a huge plus.  If you've been to other places perhaps you'll know what I mean when I say sometimes you just can't do that but here it's all good.

column1: Both times we had the same server and both times she was very friendly and helpful.  I think it was just serendipity coming across La Chingada while looking for a place to eat.  It's not everyday I come across places like this by just walking 2 blocks looking for something."
La Chingada	4	2019-11-24	"Went here for ayce tacos Thursdays ($19.95)

column1: Food (4/5): very good tacos that were way better than I expected for ayce. They were proper really good restaurant quality tacos! I love that they used corn tortillas and were generous with the filling! I tried all taco flavors and recommend the tinga de pollo

column1: La Chilaca Taqueria	5	2019-04-23	"Let's taco bout this. Affordable tacos with well sized portions. What else can you ask for ?
La chilaca taqueria is small taco shop serving delicious morsels for a great price!  Selling 3-5$ tacos and certain specials (like 10$ for 4 pastor tacos).
I ordered the carne
column2: pastor
column3: carnitas
column4: pollo
column5: and fish. I only wish I didn't get full so fast because I wanted more. Probably the closest thing I've tasted to tacos on the street in Mexico.

column1: Would highly recommend the fish ( very fresh and light) and the pastor (if you're a fan of pineapples) and if not go for the pork. They even have there own salsa station with grilled jalapeos to accompany your tacos for a complete bite. The shop is small and the interiors aren't of high class but who cares
column2: cause the food is amazing. Number Juan in my books."

column1: La Chilaca Taqueria	5	2018-07-31	"Chilaca
column2: Campechano
column3: shrimp
column4: fish

column1: The tacos are stuffed to brim so prepare for a bit of a messy experience but so worth it at $15 bucks for 3 tacos
column2: which can easily feed 2 leaving you satisfied but not too stuffed. I love that they come with hot sauces with varying degrees of spice (beware of overloading) and if you're lucky at the right time

column4: a crowd fav and a must try if it's your first time. Campechano a decent choice with a mix of meats and cheese. I definitely like the $5 tacos better with a mix of veggies and meat (fish is my fav). If you want an even cheaper way to fill yourself up
column5: multiples of chorizo or pastor tacos are a bargain. Shrimp was probably the least favourite of them all given it was a bit blander than the rest in terms of flavour.

column1: This is located inside a shared shop along with other food counters all with Latin American flavours. Cheap way to split the rent and keep the prices low."
La Chilaca Taqueria	5	2020-04-21	Excellent food quality

column1: La Chilaca Taqueria	3	2018-11-24	"I came here to try out some tacos.  The tacos average in price about $5 each.  They have different sauces that you can put on your tacos.   I tried the pork tacos.  While it wasn't bad

column1: La Chilaca Taqueria	4	2018-03-25	"Absolutely amazing! Two overflowing tacos for $5.

La Chilaca Taqueria	5	2017-11-20	"Continuing our downtown food tour we decided to try the La Chilaca Taqueria in the El Gordo complex in Kensington.
Didn't know at the time but the building houses several food stalls and this was the place where Seven Lives Tacos got there start before they exploded on the scene.
The tacos here were delicious!  For $5 you get a specialty taco and for $3 you get a basic taco but they are all fantastic!  Double wrapped
column2: stuffed with protein of your choice and freshly made in house salsas to drown your tacos in.  There is some serious value here folks!

column1: I'm not an authentic Mexican food expert but these tacos are probably more traditional ones then the Baja California ones at Seven Lives.
Which one is better?   F*ck me man don't ask me that!! Its kinda like that movie ""Sophie's Choice""
column2: which child do you choose?  I love them both but in different ways!!

column1: Its a small set up as only 2 guys work with one doing all the cooking and one helping out.  They are really nice and deserve all the success given to them.  Will be back!
La Chilaca Taqueria	3	2018-08-06	"3.5 stars to some more great options of 4 stars.  Not going to lie... it's true Kensington in every sense of the neighbourhood.
If you're willing to look past the rough and gritty exterior
column2: you may find some good tacos here.  Nothing risked is nothing gained and I feel that La Chilaca Taqueria fits that perfectly.  It's in the 'food court' of several Latin American food stalls.  Food court is an understatement... It's more like a disheveled
column3: heavily worn and dirty open non A/C store that has every stall spilling out into a small room.  It shares the space with 3 other stalls.

column1: There are some tables in the back of the dingy place but there's a weird smell emanating from the back as you sit beside several broken old unused glassed counters.  On a crazy hot day
column2: the lack of A/C makes this insane and feel like an oven.  The open back door to a few more seats barely helps.  The 'kitchen' is really a small stove top and a crammed setting of a kitchen sink and a counter to assemble.

column1: You're quickly greeted and told to look up at the menu.  There are daily deals like 2 chorizo tacos for $5 or 4 other tacos for $10.  Each taco is $5 each regardless of the type.  When we went
column2: the carnitas werent ready but they had 8 other ones you could try.  Service here is efficient but I have to admit they were all busy with the World Cup... can't blame them since the entire Kensington (let's be real... Toronto) is watching.  I do have to worry a bit when we overheard the person in the kitchen saying how can they cook this chicken in under 3 minutes... ehhhh wut?  How about cooking it till it's done?

column1: I have to admit the addition of their sauces really perked these up so grab some before taking a bite into them.  The creamy orange one has some good heat that could make you water up a bit if you're not careful.  I wasnt expecting that type of heat and wow
column2: yeah... ice cream was needed to cool my tongue.  What I thought would be the spicy red transparent sauce was actually a tomato one that didn't have any heat and just added a little bit of flavour.  There was also a nice vibrant green sauce that was very good mix of mild jalalpeno
column3: onions
column4: and cilantro.  Totally refreshing to add.

column1: Fish Taco - My favourite of the tacos.  The fish pan fried and still tender without being dried out.  This was a stuffed taco... the type where you take a bite and you realize that the sauce and pickled onions are just going to be exploding soon.  The sauce just oozes out onto your hand and you're soon licking your fingers.  The cilantro just gives a nice freshness to it... I know
column2: not everyone likes cilantro but it's good on this one.  Another thing I love about this... they double wrap the taco so they dont fall apart easily AND they toast the corn tortilla up so they're a bit crispy.  Nice one. 4/5

column1: Vegetable Taco - Soooo I keep ordering Vegetable Tacos and I keep wondering why afterwards.  My search for a good one continues but I learned that tofu and cheese really doesn't work... at... all.  I feel like you do one or the other.  It's just a weird combination.  In addition to those
column2: they had cilantro
column3: pickled onion
column4: and tomatoes. This one wasn't as flavourful so it really benefits from either the orange hot sauce (that will scorch you) or green fresh herb one.  3/5

column1: Chorizo Taco - Another solid taco with the paprika giving the pork a nice flavour.  It was cooked fresh from the sausage and it didnt taste like it was standing in some pot for a few hours.  They garnished with pickled onions and cilantro and helped cut through the rich meat.  I was told this was authentic to the style in Mexico city.  4/5

Beef Taco - Maybe I wasn't in the mood for cheese but the beef and cheese one didn't quite work.  As generous as they were with the cheese... I just felt this one was really quite heavy and a bit oily.  The beef was possibly a bit overcooked which made it a bit on the dry side.  I could have added more sauce to it but something didn't quite work as well as the chorizo.  3/5

Shrimp Taco - This was a solid one with small shrimps cooked fairly well.. they werent rubbery or dried out.  Just a nice juicy chew.  They added a spice to it that kept it out of the bland side ... though I have to admit
column2: this wasn't as flavourful as the Chorizo.  This one does work well with a sauce to keep it from being boring.  They did garnish with the usual pickled onions and cilantro.  3.5/5

column1: There are some really good tacos coming out of here and made freshly with some in house made sauces that really make the tacos pop.  BUT if you're the type where you're concerned about atmosphere
column2: this might put you off.  Worse case
column3: you can take it to go and eat it while you're walking about Kensington but just bring a few napkins
column4: ok a lot... cause you're going to be leaving a trail of food dripping otherwise!"

column1: La Chilaca Taqueria	5	2018-09-05	"La Chilaca is quintessential Kensington Market. It has an air of intrigue and imperfection that make it brilliant.

Are the burritos massive and delicious? Yes.
Are they sometimes out of pork or shrimp? Yes.

column1: Do you want to go into the washroom? Held out on all 6 previous visits
column2: so not sure.

column1: Does the food seem more authentic than the other chain restaurants that serve burritos and tacos?
A thousand times yes.
Is this a bit of a dive? Yes
column2: and maybe deeper.

column1: Are the staff here cool? If it comes without trying

La Chilaca Taqueria	4	2019-05-01	"One of my favourite spot in the city for tacos! Hidden inside Kensington market
column2: Chilaca is nearly always bustling. My go-to are the chorizo tacos($3 a piece or 4 for $10)
column3: which come with diced onions and cilantro
column4: but the pastor tacos
column5: which come with diced onions
column6: cilantro and pineapple are fabulous as well.

column1: They have house made hot sauces available and these should not be overlooked. The green ""mild"" sauce is fresh and light
column2: and adds the perfect extra bit of freshness. The orange hot sauce is not to be taken lightly. I like my food pretty spicy but I add only the smallest few drops of this to each taco because I absolutely love the flavour but damn does it have a kick! My only complaint is with their medium sauce. Over the last six months or so they have changed the recipe for their medium hot sauce. I find the new sauce far too tomatoey
column3: and with hardly any heat at all. Their previous sauce was less tomato based and had the perfect balance of heat and flavour. Would love a switch back!!

column1: On Saturdays they sometimes make a mango salsa in addition to their hot sauces which is amazing with the pastor tacos. This is originally what got me hooked on Chilaca! (Besides the great price & friendly staff).

If you head to the back of the little food prep area you'll find a small patio in the summer that's usually pretty quiet so you can enjoy your meal away from the business that is Kensington Market in the warm weather.
I would (and do) recommend this spot to everyone I know who mentions they like tacos. If you are spending a day in Toronto near Kensington and can only try tacos from one joint
column2: let it be this one."

La Chilaca Taqueria	5	2018-05-10	"Located at the back of the El Gordo complex in Kensington Market is a little hole in the wall you will not want to miss. La Chilaca Taqueria serves up authentic delicious Mexican cuisine at a price point that will knock your socks off!
I ended up trying their daily special (two Pastor Tacos for $5.00) and was thoroughly impressed. First of all
column2: these things are huge (similar to the ones at Seven Lives). They have a crisp
column3: grilled double layered corn tortilla which was absolutely delicious - soft
column4: pliable and surprisingly light with just a hint of sweetness and a slight charred flavour. What really amazed me was that the tortilla held together even with all the filling inside it!

column1: The inside of the tortilla is stuffed with a generous amount of delicious
column2: tender marinated pork which was then topped with fresh onions
column3: pineapple and cilantro. I loved how the sweet juicy pineapples added a vibrant summertime feel to the well-seasoned meat and the cilantro complimented everything with a light citrusy and peppery overtone. I squeezed on a splash of lime for a bit more of a sweet citrus kick. And then added on some of the red spicy sauce to enhance the flavours (although in retrospect
column4: I should have probably gone with the green mild sauce instead). Definitely a taco you won't want to miss!"

column1: Cinco Mexican Restaurant	5	2018-10-29	"I honestly don't know why it took us so long to come and try Cinco! We've seen it on yelp and google reviews so many times but finally decided to try it for lunch on Sunday. Located in Roncesvalles is this homey Mexican restaurant. As you walk in

column1: Hostess/waitress was great in explaining their menu to us. They have 2 types of tacos: Gourmet and Street taco. Gourmet tacos are two tortillas stuffed with cheese in between and then their taco ingredients on top. Street tacos are your typical tacos but with only 1 tortilla. We opted to try one of each. column2: squid and shrimp) with slaw on top and also the beef street taco. The beef street taco is AMAZING. So flavourful and filled with onions and cilantro on top!! We tried the chocolate filled churro and it was sooooo goood. it comes out pipping hot and with chocolate oozing out.

Cinco Mexican Restaurant	5	2018-05-07	"This is
column2: hands-down
column3: the best mexican food place in Toronto! And I would know!  I live in Cuidad de Mexico
column4: DF
column5: and have travelled (with locals) pretty much every corner of Estados Unidos de Mexico!

column1: In Toronto I've tried every single mexican restaurant in the core (no suburbs)
column2: including Los Colibris (high end)
column3: Caballito
column4: Grand Electric (fusion)
column5: etc. etc.

column1: NONE of the above places are as good as this one. None
column2: even the pricey ones!

column1: Cinco is a very small restaurant and it gets really busy around brunch on weekends. They have a special brunch menu
column2: but their regular one is also available.  The best items on the menu are tacos and they come in two varieties: specialty (lots of goodies) and regular (simple).  Specialty tacos are around $8 - two are enough for the average guy (150lbs)
column3: while the regular are around $5 and you'd probably need three to feel full. They also have a 'salsa bar' with different heat salsas - but they are all sooo goood!!!

column1: The service is good but not servile.  When it gets busy sometimes they forget stuff (no free chips)
column2: but just remind them. The flavors of the pork belly and specialty pork are to die for!  I pity the people who don't eat the tastiest meat out there because they are missing on an amazing flavor and texture experience.  The chicken is also good
column3: but the pork is waaay better.  In DF
column4: pork Tacos al Pastor are the main street food
column5: and here they are replicated almost exactly.

column1: Now a word for vegans (one nasty review down the screen
column2: scroll down
column3: you'll find it) - JUST KEEP MOVING!  This is not a restaurant for you!  I can't believe the lady who wrote the review ordered the tacos without meat AND without cheese!!!??? What's left? NOTHING - that's what!  The slow cooked meat with it's juices and mixed with the melted cheese
column4: both soaking into the corny (see what I did there) tortilla is the essence of the food experience here.  During my time in Mexico I didn't meet a single local vegetarian/vegan.  That should tell you about the essence of the cuisine.

column1: Do yourself a favor and come to this restaurant and eat the dishes as they are written in the menu (no substitutions!) - your taste buds will thank you for hours."

column1: Quetzal	5	2020-02-27	"Mr.H and I were here for a celebratory dinner

Quetzal	5	2020-02-14	"Loved loved everything! I loved how they serve smaller portion so I could try more dishes.

Quetzal	5	2020-01-23	"By far

column1: We ordered so many dishes - I dont think I can post the names of all the things we ordered! Came here for a birthday dinner and turned out great! The cocktails are mindblowing - theres many new kinds of liquers you can try here!

The food is amazing! All the food served at quetzal is grilled on Charcoal! Can you imagine the char on that beautiful steak!!!! My mouth waters as I write this review. The menu can be confusing but our server- Brad - so amazing - suggested all the right things!

Quetzal	4	2020-01-22	"Every dish I ate here

Quetzal	3	2019-12-03	"I was very excited about trying Quetzal. Upon arrival the ambiance was great
column2: with candlelit tables and a curved ceiling

column1: For the food we did the tasting menu

column3: with the scallops being were quite small and not fresh tasting. The other sushi grade fish - the kanpchi tiradito - was good in comparison. The thin crispy Masa round was similar to a taco pizza

column1: Next up
column2: the kale salad was tasty and served with the full stems. The bone marrow came with two large bones but didn't seem to have enough flavour cooked into it. Lastly
column3: the skirt steak and 18oz rib eye were served. We were never asked how we liked it cooked when ordering
column4: but we received medium rare which worked out to our tastes.

column1: Quetzal	3	2019-08-15	"Quetzal is interesting. There's this big huge space that goes for miles with a glimpse into kitchen. At the front
column2: there's a huge table with natural light

column1: The food though
column2: for Mexican just wasn't as great as the rest of the restaurant itself. Things were plated prettily (maybe a bit oddly)
column3: but nothing popped our taste buds as Mexican flavours should. It was just an okay meal. We left a bit hungry and wanting more."

column1: Quetzal	3	2018-12-22	"I had high expectations for this restaurant based on other reviews but for me
column2: it ended up being just an average meal.

column1: The restaurant itself is very nice inside. The decor is unique and the feel of the restaurant is upscale yet welcoming. Staff are very friendly and professional. I don't particularly enjoy the high seats we had
column2: but that's just me. The menu is a bit confusing so we had a lot of questions
column3: and our server was happy to explain. There were four of us dining and we had intended on ordering our own food
column4: but apparently this restaurant suggests more of a ""family style"" dining experience. I feel that this is a lazy way of serving
column5: as you're basically told that they don't care about timing your food to come out together
column6: so it's suggested you share whatever comes out first. Not my favourite way to eat when I'm dining with people I don't know very well.

column1: One of the guys at our table wanted to order a drink that was under the ""Large Format"" heading
column2: which our server explained was meant to share. She also said it could be served as a single drink if he wanted. I read the description (Velvet Krush) and decided I'd also like to try it. When our drinks were brought out
column3: it was served as a single drink with two straws. I don't know what made her think that two people sitting on opposite ends of the table from each other would want to share a drink like that
column4: but we sent it back requesting two separate glasses. Even if we had been a couple
column5: I would not want to share a drink like that. Very strange. At least the drink was really good. Something I would definitely have again.

column1: We ordered a few ceviche dishes to start. Most of the dishes were good
column2: but at this price point
column3: I honestly expected to be wowed at least with some of the dishes. The presentation was exceptional
column4: which is probably why I was disappointed
column5: as I expected everything to taste as good as it looked. I did enjoy the scallop ceviche - probably my favourite dish of all the ones I tried.

column1: I had the hanger steak as my main with a side of grilled mushrooms. The steak was cooked rare
column2: which I found to be a bit rubbery. Had it been cooked a bit more to mid-rare
column3: it probably would have been perfect. Because they sliced the steak before bringing to the table
column4: there's not much you can do to salvage it
column5: aside from ordering a new one. Given the two-hour window they impose
column6: I wasn't prepared to chance it
column7: as we were over 2/3 of our time already. The mushrooms also looked better than they tasted
column8: as I felt the broth kind of watered down the mushroom flavour rather than enhancing it. I also tasted the grilled fish and the coal roasted sweet potato
column9: but neither was to my liking. It seemed like the char from the grill kind of overpowered everything else.

column1: At the end of the meal
column2: there was nothing really outstanding for me. I'd return if I was with other people who wanted to try it
column3: but can't say I'd rush back anytime soon."

column1: Quetzal	5	2020-01-05	"This restaurant fills two gaps in Toronto:
1) a modern take on Mexican cuisine
2) a casual fine dining restaurant with an interesting take on both meat and seafood

This restaurant also has some of the most knowledgeable and service oriented wait staff I have ever encountered. I recommend not reading the menu at all and let the staff and chef curates tasting menu for you (at $65-75 per person plus tax). I have done that 3 times and every time they come up with a sequence of very thoughtful dishes that take the guests dietary reactions in consideration
column2: with great variations that changes according to season.

column1: The latest hit for me is their special lobster appetizer. Where they grill the whole lobster with spice and matcha. The right amount of heat balanced with the fresh taste of the lobster. Never saw lobster handled this way. Bravo!
This is a spot suitable for dates and groups of 4-8. Very nice atmosphere."
Quetzal	5	2019-09-03	"Finally a Mexican restaurant in Toronto that is moving the cuisine scene from $10 of poor quality

column1: They seem to have the formula down right here in terms of the atmosphere
column2: the service

column4: without overcrowding. Service is impeccable and comfortable - there's a genuineness to lengths the servers will go to ensure you're happy. In terms of quality of food - all I can say is excellent. You've got lots of authenticity here
column5: and some creativity that does't disrespect the cuisine or bastardize it.

column1: A must visit. The hype is worth it."
Quetzal	4	2019-10-22	"While we are Mexican cuisine aficionados
column2: our experience with the food hasn't strayed far from the quotidian comforts of Chipotle and Taco Bell. The concept of haute Mexican cuisine was entirely foreign to us.

column1: We were seated at the bar
column2: which which is at the front of this incredibly beautiful restaurant. The restaurant features low ceilings and incredibly soft lighting that gave it a very romantic feel. This place is seriously Instagram-friendly.

column1: Mixto ceviche: 3/5 This was the biggest disappointment of the night. I love a good ceviche
column2: and I was so excited to try this after seeing pics on other bloggers' feeds about the Mixto. When it arrived
column3: the dishes didn't match: there was less than half the amount of scallops as the blog post I referenced from a year ago. The dish itself was pretty good - it was halibut + scallops in a sour
column4: acidic bath.

column1: Citrus salad 4/5 We really enjoyed this salad
column2: and the simplicity in ingredients really surprised us. It featured grapefruit
column3: navel oranges
column4: and a green salsa. Atop the oranges were sous vide chayote slices to give it a light crunch.

column1: Blue corn masa cakes 5/5 This dish was the highlight of our night. The consistency of the cakes was absolutely amazing - it was crispy yet soft at the same time. It's hard to believe that this was a vegetarian dish; the mushrooms were extremely juicy and worked perfectly with the cheese. We could've eaten 5 of these each.
Sweet potato 3/5 This dish was highly recommended on yelp
column2: but it wasn't fantastic. The yam was good
column3: but tasted boiled - the smoke didn't really get through. The sauce was good - it resembled Lao Gan Ma closely - a Chinese black bean peanut paste. Overall
column4: things didn't really mix together. If you do get this though
column5: make sure to order a batch of tortillas to make sweet potato tacos!

column1: To sum up our critique of this place
column2: we think it's fallen to the classic trap that fancy establishments fall prey to when trying to modernize a classic cuisine: losing the integrity of the flavours. Everything felt too refined
column3: not punchy enough. While we understand the value of restraint and nuance
column4: we can't help but think that the fieriness that defines Mexican cuisine was overly diluted. Quetzal ranked 23 out of Canada's best 100 restaurants. While it was a tasty meal
column5: we wouldn't put it in our top 50.

column1: Also there's only 1 washroom. This means long lines. Don't hold it in."
Quetzal	5	2019-06-26	"It's hard for most to imagine Mexican cuisine without defaulting to tacos
column2: nachos

column1: Quetzal	4	2019-05-16	"We had an amazing time here ! Sat in the back at the chefs table which was so fun to watch the action. It was also nice to chat with the chefs. Some people mentioned it was quite warm - they did have some serious fans going on back there but it is warmer than usual. Keep that in mind if you're sensitive to heat but I was very comfortable. We ordered five dishes: two masa (chicken and mushroom)

column1: Lastly

What stood out to me was our server pointed out we had ordered quite a lot of food and offered to give us a half portion of the sunchokes. column1: Quetzal	4	2018-11-16	"Went on a Sunday

column1: My friend and I were impressed with the bartender who was great at describing the food menu and great with suggestions. We thought he had better service than Alo bar at Yorkville. We also had Alo / Aloette staff sitting beside us. They
column2: of course

column1: Food was good. Ordered the Masa with the mushrooms with it

Quetzal	5	2019-09-08	Say at the chef bar and that gave us a real appreciation for how much everyone really cared. Everything was wood fire cooked
column2: it authentic and absolutely packed with flavour. The architecture of the restaurant is immaculate and a must see. I'd recommend this for a professional night out or a date.

column1: Quetzal	4	2019-06-22	After a recent trip to the Yucatan and experiencing authentic Mexican wood-fired cuisine
column2: I have been on a mission to find similar flavours in the city of Toronto. From the moment you walk into the restaurant
column3: Hands down quetzals interior design is beautiful. The sloped ceiling creates an inviting appearance to the dining room and the open fires at the back
column4: fill the space with a smell that instantly indicated that I was in the right place. We ordered many tastes from the menu. We started with several veggie dishes including the grilled asparagus
column5: green salad and grilled runner beans. The favourite from the veggie dishes were the runner beans. They have a similar bite to cactus without the slimey texture. The addition of coconut and cotija cheese added unique flavours and textures to the earthy veggies. The restaurant makes its own masa based dishes and we opted for the Mamelas and the empanada. Both dishes were gluten free and delicious. The mamelas were a flavour bomb with trumpet mushrooms and a cheese sauce. For meat
column6: we had the chorizo
column7: steak and sweet breads. To be honest
column8: the steak was a bit chewy and not a favourite of the group. The sweet breads however
column9: were unreal. I have never had sweet breads before and the way that they were prepared at quetzal proved just how delicious a organ meat can be. For dessert we had the avocado ice cream with GRASSHOPPERS and a passion fruit mousse. I never thought I would enjoy grasshoppers but they truly added the most unique texture in contrast to the smooth creamy ice cream. All in all
column10: quetzal puts an elegant spin on true traditional Mexican fare...this place is worth a visit and the hefty bill.

column1: Quetzal	4	2019-08-20	Really delicious food that takes a twist on traditional Mexican cuisine. Tried the mixto ceviche
column2: sweet potato
column3: salad

column5: not too dark
column6: not too loud. 4 stars given due to prices but food is 5/5!

column1: Quetzal	4	2018-08-26	"I serendipitously passed by Quetzal in early August after dinner while walking along College with my girlfriend. The warm and dazzling interior immediately drew our attention. We were both full at that point
column2: but we both agreed to return again soon
column3: if at minimum to experience the stunning interior architecture.

column1: The next day
column2: my girlfriend returned to Montreal
column3: where she would be based until late September
column4: and I was left longing to try Quetzal. One week later
column5: I found myself in the College St area again
column6: visiting an old friend. Like any proper foodie boyfriend
column7: I couldn't resist temptation
column8: and ventured into Quetzal that night with my friend instead. Was it worth it to forsake my better half and visit Quetzal without her to satisfy my craving? I'd say yes. :-)

column1: I could write paragraphs about Quetzal's beautiful interior design
column2: but a picture is worth a thousand words - so perhaps you should review the photos. The owners of Quetzal did not cut any corners when designing the restaurant. Their use of curved walls
column3: diffused lighting and an open-concept kitchen made an otherwise tight and low-ceiling restaurant feel very spacious. The area was very warm and inviting
column4: and elegantly set the mood for dinner. And trust me
column5: the design was justification enough for visiting.

column1: The service was also among the best I've  experienced in Toronto - a city whose servers I too often find rude or complacent. Subtle behaviors by the waiters demonstrated Quetzal's commitment to great service. For example
column2: shortly after my friend went to the restroom
column3: a waiter took the care to refold my friends linen napkin. Another example was when I flagged a waiter down about a broken soap dispenser in the men's washroom
column4: and a worker was brought nearly immediately to fix the contraption. Above all
column5: the servers were very friendly and helpful at every interaction. The restaurant was adequately (if not over-) staffed
column6: and at the end of the day
column7: an experienced and friendly restaurant staff is a large part of what any restaurant bill *should* be going towards.

column1: And the food. It was delicious. Quetzal provides traditional Mexican fare
column2: sometimes combined with Canadian accents. I tried the following: Ceviche Verde Mixto (a fresh combination of of scallop and halibut seasoned with a lime base)
column3: poblano+Silil pak+ajo salsas (three salsas with exquisite flavors that can be eaten with fresh restaurant made tortillas or reserved for a later course)
column4: chorizo toluqueno (three generous pieces of flavorful chorizo)
column5: pescado zarandeado (an entire butterflied fish
column6: seasoned with red and green chili sauce)
column7: and pollito estillo sinaloa (butterflied wood oven cooked chicken served with luscious roasted mini potatoes and avocado sauce).

column1: One feedback about the food was that I found it a bit too subtle sometimes and a bit too unsubtle other times. For example
column2: the ceviche tasted too limey
column3: but the chili flavor on the fish or the avocado sauce on the chicken didn't pack enough punch. Another feedback is that some of our dishes were slightly overcooked. However
column4: I believe that these dishes will be fine tuned over time
column5: and I didn't consider these ""issues"" significant enough to stop me from enjoying the food. In fact
column6: I look forward to returning to try the sweetbread
column7: lamb and vegetable dishes that I was unable to try during my first visit.

column1: Quetzal is an ambitious upscale Mexican restaurant venture that is sure to impress across a variety of dimensions - food
column2: service and design. Quetzal gets it and does not compromise on experience. I recommend going with 3-4 friends and ordering a bunch of different plates to try a bit of each."

column1: Los Guaca-Moles	5	2018-09-21	"Super-nice back patio and friendly service. Artfully made food. My wife and I stumbled by accidentally. We'd already had dinner earlier that night

column1: Los Guaca-Moles	4	2018-04-29	"My boyfriend and I came here on Friday and had a really positive experience. We stopped in after an event and were looking for a yummy meal.
When you first walk in
column2: you'll notice a Mexican flag covering the door and a long narrow area for guests to sit. Our waiter came over and seated us at a table. The restaurant was dimly lit and it created the perfect environment for a date night.

column1: We asked our waiter which tacos he would recommend with my two food allergies (I'm both gluten and lactose intolerant) and he recommended we try La Tinga and El Nopal. We also ordered two Lime Margaritas.
La Tinga Taco
La Tinga is a chicken taco served on a soft corn tortilla. We both found this taco a little bland. The chicken didn't have much flavour; we couldn't really taste the chipotle sauce
column2: the red sauce or the flavour of the onions. (If you visit this restaurant I do not recommend you try this dish).

column1: El Nopal Taco
I was surprised the waiter suggested we try El Nopal taco. It is a vegetarian taco and I didn't expect it to be as good as La Tinga. To our surprise
column2: El Nopal pushed La Tinga out of the water. El Nopal was absolutely fantastic! It is made with a corn tortilla
column3: cactus strips marinated in a green tomatillo sauce
column4: coriander and crispy tortilla bits.

column1: This was my first time trying a cactus dish and I absolutely loved it! The tacos had a lot of flavour and the cactus flesh was the texture of a root vegetable. I honestly don't know how to explain the flavours of this dish but it is definitely something you need to try!
Lime Margaritas:

We ordered two lime Margaritas and really enjoyed them. I was surprised they arrived on the rocks instead of as a slushy (I missed that memo in the menu) but it was prepared really well. The drinks has the perfect tart flavour and they were quite refreshing.
Would I Return to this restaurant???
Absolutely!!  I'd love to try some of their other tacos and I love how they can accommodate different food intolerances."
Los Guaca-Moles	5	2019-10-26	Best Mexican food I have had in Canada!! Everything was excellent!! Enchiladas were my favourite

Ristorante Sotto Sotto	5	2019-02-06	"What a fantastic place! A hidden gem at that! We had reservations and once we arrived we were immediately seated upstairs in a dim area lit with candles.
